string.name: title_schedule
string.translation_description: The title for the schedule screen where user can see their schedule for Google I/O.

string.translation_description: The title for the map screen where user can see the map of the venue.

string.name: title_info
string.translation_description: The title for the info screen where user can see various information, such as FAQ and travel info.

string.name: filters
string.translation_description: The label for the button to filter sessions by their topics, room, and so on.

string.name: category_heading_types
string.translation_description: Label in the filters panel above event types (Sessions, Codelabs, etc.)

string.translation_description: The label for the button to clear all the filter conditions.

string.name: reset
string.translation_description: The label for the button to reset the filter conditions.

resources.string: Showing only starred and reserved events

string.name: agenda
string.translation_description: The title for the agenda screen where user can see all the sessions they plan to attend.

string.name: event_starred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user adds an event to their schedule.

resources.string: Event added to your starred items

string.name: event_unstarred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user removes an event from their schedule.

string.name: event_star_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user tries to add an event.

resources.string: Error adding event to starred items

string.name: reservation_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user is trying to reserve a session attendance.

resources.string: Error making changes to reservation. Wait for previous requests to finish or try again later.

string.name: reservation_request_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user tries to reserve a seat for a session.

string.name: reservation_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation for a session.

string.name: reservation_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is confirmed by the system.

resources.string: Your seat has been reserved for \"%s\".

string.name: reservation_replaced
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has chosen to replace a reservation for another and it is confirmed by the system.

string.name: waitlist_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is added to the waitlist of a session reservation.

string.name: waitlist_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation and was waitlisted for a session.

string.name: got_it
string.translation_description: The label for dismissing a information messages.

string.name: dont_show
string.translation_description: The label for opting out of in-app notification messages.

string.name: reservation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Reservation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: reservation_denied_clash
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because they have reserved another event at that time

resources.string: Reservation denied: clash with another reservation

string.name: reservation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because of an unknown error

string.name: cancellation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Cancellation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: cancellation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because of an unknown error

string.name: schedule_filters_empty
string.translation_description: The message shown when a schedule page is empty because no events match the current filters.

resources.string: Sign in to save events, reserve seats and rate sessions (if an attendee). Actions will be synced from your account across app and site.

resources.string: You\'re about to give up your seat for \"%1$s\". If you decide not to reserve a seat but still want to attend, all sessions will have a portion of seats available first come, first serve onsite.

string.name: remove
string.translation_description: The label of the button to release the seat.

string.name: swap_reservation_content
string.translation_description: The content of the dialog when the user is about to change their reservation from one session to another.

resources.string: You already have a reservation/waitlist for \"%1$s\". Only one reservation per time block is allowed. Would you like to swap for \"%2$s\"?

string.name: swap
string.translation_description: The label of the button to swap the reservation with another.

string.translation_description: The title of the dialog for the notifications preference

string.name: notifications_preference_dialog_content
string.translation_description: The content of the dialog for the notifications preference

resources.string: Would you like to receive notifications about I/O? We\'ll send you information about session start times, after hours events, session recordings, and more. You can change this setting under \"Info > Settings\" at any time.

string.name: yes

string.name: travel_directions_title
string.translation_description: Header label for driving directions details.

string.name: travel_shuttle_title
string.translation_description: Header label for shuttle service details.

string.name: travel_carpool_parking_title
string.translation_description: Header label for parking and carpooling details.

string.name: travel_ride_sharing_title
string.translation_description: Header label for ride sharing app details (i.e. Lyft Line, Waze Carpool).

string.name: travel_public_transportation_title
string.translation_description: Header label for public transportation details.

string.name: travel_biking_title
string.translation_description: Header label for bicycling details

string.name: travel_directions_description
string.translation_description: Instructions on how to find directions to the conference.

resources.string: Find directions on Google Maps or Waze to 1 Amphitheatre Pkwy, Mountain View, CA 94043

string.name: travel_shuttle_description
string.translation_description: Shuttle service instructions.

resources.string: Event shuttles will be provided at no charge to all Google I/O attendees from all Google-recommended hotels. There is also select service from San Francisco and other locations along the Peninsula. You must show your Google I/O confirmation email or conference badge to board all Google I/O event shuttles.\n\nEach pick-up location can support accessible vehicles. Please indicate on your registration form if you have any special assistance requirements, and the planning team will follow up with you directly.

string.name: travel_carpool_parking_description
string.translation_description: Carpool and parking instructions.

resources.string: Parking is very limited and available only in Google I/O designated lots located across from Shoreline Amphitheatre along Shoreline Boulevard. There is no event parking along Amphitheatre Parkway or Charleston Road. If you plan to drive, we recommend carpooling with other attendees as preferred parking spaces will be available for cars containing two or more people.

string.name: travel_ride_sharing_description
string.translation_description: Ride sharing app instructions and discounts.

resources.string:
Waze Carpool
Waze Carpool is a trusted community of drivers and riders that is available to make your Google I/O commute fun, fast and affordable. Driving? Open Waze when you get to the Bay Area. Looking for a ride? Install Waze Carpool before you arrive. Check back here in the coming weeks for carpool discount codes exclusive to Google I/O attendees.

Lyft Line
Download the Lyft app from Google Play and use Lyft Line to share a ride for less with others going the same way.
Discount code: Googleio18
This code is valid from May 8–10, 2018 for shared rides with Lyft Line. It’s redeemable for up to $10 per trip and for up to 250 users per day. Rides must begin or end at Shoreline Amphitheatre.

string.name: travel_public_transportation_description
string.translation_description: Public transportation instructions.

resources.string: Public transit doesn’t go directly to Google I/O. Stay tuned for the exact transportation locations serviced by Google I/O event shuttles.

string.name: travel_biking_description
string.translation_description: Bicycle instructions.

resources.string: Complimentary bike parking will be available at Shoreline Amphitheatre in Parking Lot A. The Silicon Valley Bicycle Coalition will provide secure valet parking for your bicycle from 7am until the event ends each day. There are two trails, Stevens Creek Trail and Permanente Creek Trail, that are convenient for bike riders heading to Shoreline Amphitheatre. Check Google Maps for the best bike routes and directions.\n\nThe Bay Area Bike to Work Day is scheduled on Thursday, May 10th. There will be thousands of cyclists participating near Shoreline and there are hundreds of energizer stations throughout the area. Please check out the Silicon Valley Bike to Work Day website for more information.

string.translation_description: Link label for viewing all sessions in schedule.

string.name: event_sessions_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "sessions".

string.name: event_sandbox_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general "sandbox" description.

string.name: event_codelabs_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "codelabs".

string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "office hours and app reviews".

string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "after hours"

string.name: event_meals_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "meals"

string.name: event_sessions_description
string.translation_description: General information on sessions

resources.string: Starting in April, in-person attendees can reserve seats for Sessions in advance of the event on the I/O website and also via the I/O mobile app (note: a portion of Session seats will be exempt from reservations and available first-come, first-served onsite). Attendance at Codelabs, App Reviews, and Office Hours is on a first-come, first-served basis onsite.

string.name: event_sandbox_description
string.translation_description: General information on sandboxes.

resources.string: Dedicated spaces to explore, learn, and play with our latest products and platforms via interactive demos, physical installations, and more.

string.name: event_codelabs_description
string.translation_description: General information on codelabs.

resources.string: Get hands-on experience in our ready-to-code kiosks. Here, you’ll have everything you need to learn about the latest and greatest Google technologies via self-paced tutorials, or bring your own machine and take your work home with you. Google staff will be on hand for helpful advice and to provide direction if you get stuck.

string.name: event_officehours_description
string.translation_description: General information on office hours and app reviews.

resources.string: Office Hours are your chance to meet one-on-one with Google experts to ask all your technical questions, and App Reviews will give you the opportunity to receive advice and tips on your specific app-related projects.

string.name: event_afterhours_description
string.translation_description: General information on after hours.

resources.string: After Sessions end for the day, stick around Shoreline for two evenings of food, drinks, and fun. On the first night, the party will take over the Sandbox space, and on the second night, we\'ll have an exclusive concert in the Amphitheatre.

string.name: event_meals_description
string.translation_description: General information on meals.

resources.string: Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks on all three days of the conference. Dinner will also be available on Day 1 and 2 during the After Hours events.
